organization.$: Faculty of Electronic and Computer Engineering

head.citation-title: Parking Space Detection Using Quaternionic Local Ranking Binary Pattern
head.abstracts: © 2018 IEEE.In the digital age, some places have been installed with a surveillance camera, especially in a parking lot. In order to make use of that camera, a parking space detection is developed to help users find empty spaces. With so many paper that also studied this kind of system, we want to explore another feature extraction that could be used in this system. One particular feature extraction algorithm that we selected is quaternionic local ranking binary pattern (QLRBP). We also used local binary pattern (LBP) to compare it's performance. The result shows that QLRBP is able to achieve the accuracy score above 99%, but with expense of large feature vector size.
